intro: Weberbauera cymosa, commonly known as the clustered weberbaueraceae, is a species of flowering plant in the family Weberbaueraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is typically found in humid, lowland tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
